snippet: Licensed gun owners who are at least 21 would be able to carry concealed weapons on public college campuses in Georgia if Gov. Nathan Deal signs the bill.
abstract: Georgia Senate passes bill that would allow licensed gun owners 21 years of age or older to carry concealed firearms on public college campuses; Gov Nathan Deal is likely to sign bill.
lead_paragraph: Licensed gun owners who are at least 21 would be able to carry concealed weapons on public college campuses in Georgia if Gov. Nathan Deal signs the bill.

headline.main: Georgia: Lawmakers Advance Bill Allowing Concealed Guns on Campus
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Lawmakers Advance Bill Allowing Concealed Guns on Campus
